name: The Great Gatsby
description: A story of the Jazz Age, its decadence, and moral emptiness

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel about racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South
A dystopian novel about totalitarianism, surveillance, and control

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A classic novel about love, marriage, and social status in Georgian England

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel narrated by a disaffected teenager in New York City

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit who embarks on an epic quest

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the young wizard's journey at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: An epic high fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring

name: Moby-Dick
description: A novel about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge on the white whale Moby Dick

name: The Alchemist
description: A novel about a shepherd named Santiago who goes on a journey to find his personal legend
